title: Crisis Support and Emergency Resources
content:
If you or someone you know is in crisis, please reach out for help immediately. You are not alone, and support is available 24/7.

National Crisis Hotlines:
- 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline: Call or text 988 for free, confidential support 24/7. Trained crisis counselors can help with suicidal thoughts, mental health crises, substance abuse, and more.
- Crisis Text Line: Text 'HELLO' to 741741 to connect with a trained crisis counselor. Available 24/7, free, and confidential.
- Veterans Crisis Line: Call 988 then press 1, text 838255, or chat online. Specialized support for veterans and their families.

Emergency Services:
- If you or someone else is in immediate danger, call 911 or go to your nearest emergency room.

Online Resources:
- National Suicide Prevention Lifeline (suicidepreventionlifeline.org): Chat online, find resources, create a safety plan.
- Crisis Text Line (crisistextline.org): Information about text support.
- SAMHSA National Helpline (1-800-662-4357): Free, confidential treatment referral and information service for mental health and substance abuse.

Remember: Reaching out for help is a sign of strength, not weakness. Crisis counselors are trained to help and will not judge you. All services are free and confidential.
